Picture Day : Haryarti

Posted on July 1, 2013 by

Happy July!  Today’s image dump of awesome is of artworks by “haryarti” from Kazakhstan.  You can find more fantastic artwork at his Deviant Art page.  Enjoy!

Are you an artist/photographer/sculptor who loves Steampunk as much as I do?   Would you like to see your work featured on this blog?  Or, do you know of someone else who’s work you adore?  Please leave a comment on this post with a link or two!   I’ll happily feature anything that I think will fit the style of my blog.  And even if I don’t feature it, please please leave your info in a comment anyway!  More art is always better than less.

Posted in Picture Day Tagged artwork, Clockwork Twist, CWTwist, Emily Thompson, haryarti, neo-Victorian, painting, steampunk Leave a comment

So much love for my peeps! The Clockwork Alchemy photo dump.

Posted on June 3, 2013 by

I had a great time at Clockwork Alchemy!  I was delighted to watch my Twist go out into the world, in good hands.  Not to mention, of the massive stack of books I brought with me, I sold out!!  *faints*

As promised, here are photos of some of the lovely people who bought a copy at the con.  I’m sorry to say that I didn’t get everyone by pure, scatterbrained forgetfulness.  So, if you bought a copy and don’t see your photo here, please don’t take offense.   I would have taken a shot if I’d remembered.  Everyone’s costumes were so lovely!  I just have to show off.

Did you spot me?  Here’s a shot of my (super easy thanks to Halloween) costume, and my synth dread fohawk, in the authors’ library.

Me and my super cute dragon!

Mom and I, braving a dark and mysterious London backstreet…

Good times … good times…  Well, thanks again to everyone to came to visit us at the con!  I was really a blast, I learned a lot, and I can’t wait for next year.

Posted in Picture Day Tagged clockwork alchemy, Clockwork Twist, Emily Thompson, neo-Victorian, photography, self publishing, steampunk Leave a comment

Picture Day: Miyumon’s fantastic artwork!

Posted on May 6, 2013 by

It’s the first Monday of the month, and that means it’s time for something pretty.

This month it’s Miyumon, a fantastic artist I found just recently.  Tell me that this first image doesn’t eerily embody the soul of my Twist!  Isn’t it wonderful?

Click on the image to go to her diviantART page.  Below you will find some more delightfuls that I found there.  Go check out all of her work!

Fun with old photos!

Posted on April 1, 2013 by

In honor of April Fools, here’s a bit of fun!  Browsing a bit too much, I came across some funny old photos that really caught my eye.  Victoriana has so many sides to it, it’s sometimes easy to forget a few.  First off, not sure if it’s really Victorian or Edwardian, but here’s a “Victorian photobomb” I found on Memebase.

This girl has her own brand of swag.  I bet she could tell you some stories.  And I think the pearls set off the jungle scene fantastically, don’t you?

Last but surely not least, Victorian Surrealism!!  Oh boy, oh boy!  The internet loves me.  It gives me all the nicest thing!  All I can say is that I want more.  Click the image to see other wonderful bits of bizarre by the fantastic artist,  Jeffrey Michael Harp.
